page.title: 08PILTANTON BURN
page.content: All along the Piltanton, the banks were overgrown with vegetation and in some areas the burn was almost obscured from sight by overhanging reeds. Erosion from map{ref. 062 572} was visible on the right hand bank with a series of small rapids in the burn. No depositon was present (or visible) until map{ref. 063 568}. There were several points of geographical interest along the area studied. At the beginning map{ref. {057 578}there is a confluence of 3 burns, further on the map{ref. 062 572 the rivers former course was visible. At map{ref. 063 571}there was evidence of a disused dam where there was extensive erosion of the banks revealing brick red sandy soil. At the end of the section under study there was a small tributary at{map ref. 077 {565. }
